newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Interform to issue 100 mln new shares.
newsitem.headline: Interform to issue 100 mln new shares.

text.p: Interform Ceramics Technologies Ltd said its chairman would buy 100 million new shares, or 12.32 percent of the enlarged share capital, at HK$1.135 each after he placed the same amount of existing shares at the same price.
Interform shares ended at HK$1.24 each on Friday.

The ceramics production line supplier said its chairman and controlling shareholder Ngan Man Po had through his wholly-owned Great Chance Holdings Ltd agreed to place 100 million existing shares to institutional and professional investors.
On completion of the placement and subscription, Great Chance's stake in Interform will be reduced to 45.31 percent from 51.67 percent, it said.

Of the HK$111 million net proceeds raised from the subscription, HK$40 million will be used to buy a ceramics factory in Foshan in China's Guangdong Province, HK$30 million for general working capital and the balance for other investments under consideration by the company.
